page.title: 15Buildings in Ripe
page.content: Next to Ripe church stands the Old Rectory, a 2-storeyed house early 19C.. Eckington Manor, is early 18C. with 2 storeys and attic. White Cottage, Church Lane, is 18C.. Mill Farm House, Firle Rd., is an L shaped farmhouse 17C. or earlier. Hall Court Farmhouse, Firle Rd., is circa 18, a 2-storey building with grey headers, red brick dressings and coins. In Main Street Yew Tree Cottages is a T shaped 15C. timber-framed building. The Manor House is circa 16C. is L shaped and timber-framed. Manor Farmhouse West end is 17C. and East end 19C. Curls Cottages a timber framed 17C. building refaced with brick and tile hung on the first storey. Curls Farmhouse is an L shaped 18C. house in red brick with grey headers. Eckington House L shaped timber framed house built in late 16C.
